rComments: Hardest class ever! Good thing he curved. When I took it, he said getting a 50 is passing.
One of the worst structured classes at UCSC.

If you want to learn the material he expects you to know for the test don't expect that learning to happen in class or in the book. Try to find video lectures online for a better understanding. The most important is to try to get your hands on the old tests that he has given out because the questions get recycled. Good luck!

Funny guy, but not a particularly good teacher. In his defense, the material is pretty dry to begin with, but it didn't feel like he made a huge effort to spice it up. Could have used more in depth examples or more thoroughly explain concepts. Focused too long on easy material at the beginning of the class.
I really did try to like him, but he clearly had no respect for the students and their progress.

He could care less if you pass for fail, and even says so. Likes to pull poisson questions from thin air and not test you on the homework he assigns. He is not helpful at teaching and even scowls at you for not knowing the basic material (which is not basic at all). At the end of the day, just the worst teacher I've had the pleasure of having.

I will always remember the exact moment I lost all respect for Brandwajn. When somebody expressed their frustration with the second midterm containing material that was not at all like the homework/practice problems, he stared at everyone for a moment before shrugging and saying, "Oh. Well, that happens." I was not cool with that.

The material is boring and although he is a humorous person he can't really help with that(no one can). Attend his classes and do the homeworks and make sure you get the womework right as it is a big part of your grade. I agree learning the material needs an intuition which one can gain practicing a lot. He is a really nice teacher, overall.

Very good humored teacher but has been teaching the subject too long; he is disconnected from how to teach it to newcomers of probability. Has a small window for office hours and redirects all help requests to his TAs. Make study groups early and go to section; it will help a lot in this class.

If you are reading this review, chances are that your major requires you to take CMPE 107. Unfortunately, no other professor ever teaches this course. Brandwajn is unclear in class, is condescending to students, and expects you to have some advanced concepts automatically known. My advice: study old tests.  May god have mercy on your soul.

I don't see why so many people write him off as hostile or mean to his students. Brandwajn (pronounced brand-wahn) is a nice guy. He cracks the occasional joke in class, which I guess people find offensive. Grow up and learn how to take a joke. This class was exactly how he said it would be: easy first and hard at the end. Just study. I got an A.

I'm an old student of Prof. Brandwajn.  I was part of the 2nd entering class to the CE program when it started over 20 years ago.  I had the misfortune of taking 2 classes from Dr. Brandwajn.  I believe I got B's in both classes.  This man refused to elaborate at times because he thought it was obvious to us geeks.  His words not mine.

He's very well organized and presents the material very sensibly... it's just that the material is very difficult to teach in so little time. GO TO CLASS, because even people who can usually afford to skip it (like me) will crash and frickin' burn without attending regularly. Although I will say I'm rather surprised with the B I got in this course.

I actually think he's a great teacher, the thing is this is an EXTREMELY difficult class, class examples are more important to know then HW imho.  He comes off as hostile but anyone who went to his office hours will see he has a genuine concern for his students passing.

Class starts out a piece of cake, then goes rapidly down hill. Knows his stuff, but does NOT know how to convey it clearly to students. Last two midterms were next to impossible: expects you to figure stuff out on them that was not covered in HW or lecture. CS majors should take the AMS option. Please STOP teaching, Mr. Brandwajn!

Professor Brandwajn is not a very good teacher. The class would have been a much better learning experience if we had a professor that didn't come off as hostile towards comments and questions in class. If your a CS major, I would suggest taking the AMS alternative to this glass. If you're EE or CE, well, have fun.

How is this guy still teaching??  He is by far the worst Professor I have ever had.  He is arrogant beyond words, he is an anti-American French homer who writes tests that are meant to destroy the morale of his students! Wow, u won't ever encounter a teacher this bad

This is one of the most useless classes i have ever taken.  Not only was it taught poorly the teacher mocked the class saying we were stupid throughout the course.  The only saving grace was there was a good TA.
very bad

I liked the clarity and detail with which he taught the class.He is a bit too tough though and it appears as though he ridicules students who ask questions/give answers that he thinks are not up to his mark.He should try to be more approachable and stop harping about the french system of education.Overall he is a good teacher though somewhat mean.

Wow, he failed nearly the entire class, just like last quarter. Tests are unreasonable-he expects you to use lots of math tricks unrelated to the material to solve the problems. Makes a show of being concerned with everyones progress, but guess what:when the entire class looks at you in stunned silence, WE DONT UNDERSTAND! Do.Not.Continue.Teaching.
go back to France. he will always be remembered as the one who failed 75% of his class. (i consider withdraw/drop as failures too, why else would they have dropped the class?)

Aweful, absolutely aweful.  Nearly failed the entire class.  Grading was unfair, and it was next impossible to grasp the material he discussed.  Every lecture he would talk about how much better the French education system is than ours. STOP TEACHING!!!!!
A horrible teacher. I learned next to nothing in his class while getting an A. He would just read off his slides (which were straight from the horrible book). I'd avoid him at all costs.
No Comments

Beware of Prof. Brandwajn.He went on an evangelistic crusade to fail everyone in this course.His esoteric lectures,along with being hard to read because he refuses to write darker, are laced with anti-americanism and french jingoism.
